note: Health expenditure per capita is measured in current [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation), which adjusts for price differences between countries.
title: Life expectancy vs. health expenditure per capita
subtitle: Life expectancy is the average number of years a newborn infant would live if prevailing patterns of mortality at the time of its birth were to stay the same throughout its life. Current health expenditure includes healthcare goods and services consumed, excluding capital health expenditures such as buildings, machinery, IT and stocks of vaccines for emergency or outbreaks.
sourceDesc: UN, World Population Prospects (2022); WHO (via World Bank)
